reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night in Melbourne before leaving for Cairnes. The Hotel is next to the river which has numerous restaurants and shops within a short walking distance. The tram system is also five minute away so the location is perfect to see the city. The room was very nice and certainly is far superior to most Travelodge rooms in the US.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was spacious with sofa,table & chairs,microwave,kettle,& very clean. Overall the standard was higher than some far more expensive hotels. Within walking distance of the city centre with lots of bars/restaurants very close.Pay-as-you go I T access in the lobby. Good value help yourself breakfast available every morning. Overall an excellent choice if you need a base in the city for few days.
reviews.title: Delighted with the standard of accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights and hotel was great. Room was good size and well equipped, including kit for self-catering. Hotel had laundry facilities so was good for short or long stay. Reception staff were helpful and price for stay was good. Breakfast was an excellent full English in self-service dining room. Hotel is a minute away from bars and restaurants on southbank and 5 min walk across river to rest of Melbourne. Parking is on a concessionary basis in adjacent multi-story and was no problem at all. Overall a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Great location and good standard of accommodation
Great location. No problems.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Traveldoge Southbank Melbourne for 3 nights of our trip of a lifetime honeymoon to Australia in December 2008. We chose this hotel based on previous reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We were initially allocated a room on the first floor, next to the air con units so we asked to be moved to a higher floor and were moved immediately. The room was basic but large and clean and well equipped with a fridge, sink and microwave! It is in a great location and hotel guests get discounted admission to the Eureka Tower, which is next door. We had a reservation on the Colonial Tramcar Restaurant while in Melbourne, which is highly recommended.

I stayed here for fourth nights very recently and was very happy with the hotel. Firstly, the location is top drawer, a one minute walk from the southgate walkway along the river with lovely cafes and very good places to eat. A 5 minute walk to Swanston street, federation square, town hall etc. You would be hard pressed to find a better location.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent decent sized modern, clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in November during Melbourne Cup week. Ideal location as it was within 10minutes walk to Flinders Street Station and all the attractions in Melbourne.
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We self catered whilst we were there but breakfast was available if required. Good clean tourist / business hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Travelodge for 4 nights as we had tickets to the Australian Open Tennis. We found that all the Melbourne Hotels put up their prices during the Tennis and we paid A$250 a night ( no breakfast ) . The hotel is in an excellent location close to the river and we could walk to the tennis centre. The room was quite large with a couch , desk & coffee table as well as the queen size bed. The room had a microwave , fridge , kettle and was well equiped. Can't say it was good value as we paid top price but was pleased overall. Only negative was that the shower floor and walls were not that clean.
reviews.title: Great place to stay during the tennis

reviews.text: I stayed at the Travelodge over the Australia Day holiday for the Australian Open tennis. It was a great hotel: neat; clean; good value. It was a pleasant walk over to Melbourne park along the river, and a short walk into town. Would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Clean, Good Location, Good Value

reviews.text: The hotel rooms were a good size with a double bed and a fould out sofa bed. The room was pretty basic, but it was clean and well presented. The check in staff were good; they let me check in at 9am as I was very tired from my flight from the UK. The location of the hotel was perfect. It is only a 5 min walk to get into the city, and there are a large number of good pubs / bars / resterants very close to the hotel.
reviews.title: What a shocker
Great location, is what it says on the tin
reviews.text: It isn't often that I stay at a hotel that I speak of in glowing terms to my family and friends. The Travelodge Southbank in Melbourne is one of those rare few.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located at Southbank directly next to the new Eureka Tower, the Travelodge is a well priced, comfortable and well staffed hotel. It is a short walk across the foot bridge into town, a shorter walk to the Crown casino and many restaurants and bars within a short radius.
reviews.title: Great location on a budget!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are comfortable and and clean, old style TV with Foxtel pay tv. Plug-in cable internet is available for an additional price. No room service is available although menus for 2 local restaurants are included.
reviews.title: Just what you need
Great value for money
reviews.text: Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. I'm usually a 4-5 star hotel goer, so this 3.5 star hotel was one that pleasantly surprised me. Would definitely stay again.

We stayed a Saturday night at the Travelodge. Overall the hotel is great for a budget, clean and basic. You can't beat the location for the price! Most staff were friendly, although they had little patience when we asked about holds on our credit card. We booked over
reviews.title: Very convenient, nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a Xmas party to attend at Southbank so we stayed at the Travelodge, which was literally a 50 metre walk away. The room was small, but clean and perfectly adequate for our needs given that we were only sleeping there. At $130 it was reasonable value. The bathroom was spacious and the bed quite comfortable given that we are both fussy about beds. I'd recommend this place for a no-frills, convenient city stay.
reviews.title: Good value, great location

reviews.text: The hotel is situated right on the Southbank, so is in easy walking distance from plenty of restaurants and shops. The hotel looks abit worn from the outside, but the rooms were adequate. Our room was quite small, but was tidy. The staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Central city location

reviews.text: The Travelodge Southbank is a great value for the money. It is a no-frills hotel that is located right in the middle of the Southbank development along the Yarra River. There are no real views from the hotel, there is no restaurant (although there is a breakfast room) or bar, but it is in a well-suited location if you are traveling to Melbourne.
reviews.title: A great location in Melbourne

reviews.text: No more than 100 meters away is the large Southbank shopping centre. There are some great food options in the shopping centre, many with commanding views of the Yarra River. There are also inexpensive food options in the food court on the lower level of the centre.
reviews.title: Tidy and Practical Accommodation in Superb Location

reviews.text: The hotel itself is a busy place. You will see large tour groups checking in and out, so the lobby area can me moving at a frenetic pace.
reviews.title: Very Pleased with my Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's been said by others but I echo their comments. We stayed for 7 nights and if you just need a clean, convenient place to stay, look no further. You are within walking distance of transportation, restaurants, bars, and even the Crown casino.
reviews.title: Great Location, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a Travelodge and not the Four Seasons so expect a smallish room but it has a small fridge, a microwave, a hotpot for making hot water in a few minutes, and dishes and cups.
reviews.title: What a gem of a hotel in Melbourne

reviews.text: Just back from spending two nights at the Travelodge and I was very impressed with the quality of this hotel. Excellent location , no fuss check in and check out, breakfasts are wonderful. beautiful clean and quiet room. Will definately stay here again. I,ve visited Melbourne on numerous occasions and have paid a lot more for a lot less, great value for money, well done everyone!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were booked into the Travelodge by Goway Travel and were very pleased. The location is great, close to Crowne Casino, restaurants and the CBD. Ate the breakfast one day but rather a steep price for a buffet. The room was large enough for two and was clean and bright. Stayed here on two separate vacations and will stay here in the future.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT VALUE
Good value... Used [---] to get best price
reviews.text: Very good value and very central. Seems like different hotel sites have different prices, so I used [---] which checks over 28 hotel sites and found the cheapest. Recommend.
Great location, 5 min walk across the footbridge to the Flinders Street Train Station, and the city.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: Very clean and tidy.
reviews.title: Fine hotel great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Having paid for a "budget" hotel I didnt expect much, but we had a very nice stay, and what a good location.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I tried to cancel some future bookings at other cities, so that I could book in at the local Travelodge.
reviews.title: Good Hotel / Best Location at a reasonable price

reviews.text: I will certainly use this chain if we return to Australia. They are not 4 star hotels, but a good standard and amazing value.
reviews.title: It is All Good

reviews.text: Loved our stay here....Fantastic location in the nicest part of Melbourne beside the Yarra River, next to top resturants, foodhalls for easy cheap meals, shopping, theatres and National Art Gallery. Excellent value for money, friendly helpful staff, modern rooms with small kitchen and tiled bathroom, comfortable beds From this hotel you can sample the best that Melbourne has to offer.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided against the $18 hotel breakfast and chose one of the resturants along the River-front serving breakfast from 7am .We can recommend IL Gusto, from the hotel walk toward the river and about 3 resturants along on the right, cheaper and you are seated beside the river. (We had a great evening meal here too.)
reviews.title: Great Location and Excellent Value

likes.liked: — very high standard for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a winner if you are after location, cleanliness, comfort and functional facilities at a budget price. I booked through hotelclub.com and got a rate of AUS$119.00 per night. This didn't include breakfast but I would much rather head out to one of many delicious cafes located nearby. I think the only downfall is the lack of a bath which would be lovely to soak aching feet after a day of walking. Highly recommend it and will stay again...
reviews.title: Second time and would stay again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the centre of the Southbank and close to all the restaurants and shopping, just a short walk to the station. A near new property, with ordinary but well presented rooms, helpful staff. Good value buffet breakfast on the ground floor, but no lunch or dinner restaurant on the property - with a huge selection nearby its easy to see why not!
reviews.title: Ideal location at a realistic price

reviews.text: Others have accurately reviewed the hotel and the great location for the price. Rather than repeating, I will provide our individual experience and some tips.
reviews.title: Tips for your Travelodge stay

reviews.text: We arrived around 9am after a long nonstop from LAX. Rooms were not ready, but they were happy to provide luggage storage while we went to explore Melbourne. An issue came up at check-in. I had prepaid to “lock” in the exchange rate when I made the reservation. The clerk was a younger Asian guy and he insisted reservations are never prepaid; he did not look at his computer or any paperwork. I politely assured him prepayment had been made, but when I asked him to check he was rather officious and arrogant about it. I said when we unpacked I could provide confirmation of payment and he muttered, “If you really have it”. Rather rude! (Later a different clerk glanced at her computer and said “No worries, I see you’re all paid !”).
reviews.title: An absolute gem in a fantastic City

reviews.text: Our stay was 4 nights and the hotel was comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Another win for the Travelodge - you just might have to wait for the lifts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from 4 days in Melbourne staying at the Travelodge Southbank. It is certainly not a flash hotel but the price is right, and the location excellent.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: I must admit I probably won't go back but I would prefer to pay a little more and get something a bit nicer. This is somewhere on the scale closer to motel than hotel.
reviews.title: clean, modern, and fantastic location
